name: MNIST
description: A dataset of 70,000 grayscale images of handwritten digits (0-9) with a resolution of 28x28 pixels. It is widely used for benchmarking classification algorithms in deep learning.

name: CIFAR-10
description: A dataset containing 60,000 32x32 color images in 10 classes, with 6,000 images per class. It is a standard benchmark for evaluating image classification models.

name: ImageNet
description: A large-scale dataset with over 14 million images labeled across 1,000 classes. It serves as the benchmark for image classification and object detection tasks.

name: COCO (Common Objects in Context)
description: A dataset designed for object detection, segmentation, and image captioning tasks, containing over 330,000 images and 80 object categories.

name: Fashion-MNIST
description: A dataset of 70,000 grayscale images of fashion items like shirts, shoes, and bags, designed as a drop-in replacement for MNIST with a similar resolution of 28x28 pixels.

name: Pascal VOC
description: A dataset with 20 object classes for object detection, classification, and segmentation tasks. It contains over 10,000 images annotated with bounding boxes and segmentation masks.

name: CelebA
description: A dataset of over 200,000 celebrity images annotated with 40 attributes such as gender, age, and hairstyle. It is widely used for attribute prediction and facial recognition tasks.

name: LSUN (Large-scale Scene Understanding)
description: A dataset containing millions of labeled images across 10 scene categories, such as bedrooms, churches, and classrooms, for scene recognition and generative tasks.

name: Oxford-IIIT Pet Dataset
description: A dataset of 37 pet categories with around 200 images per class, including annotations for species, breed, and segmentation masks.

name: Kaggle Cats vs Dogs
description: A dataset containing 25,000 images of cats and dogs, used for binary image classification tasks.
